title: Intelligence Analyst
description: Section Leader (NCOIC)- Signals Intelligence Analysis (SIGINT) Squad and Platoon Leader Tactical Intelligence Experience Experience in All Source Analysis in support of USF-I Counter-IED Task Force Troy J2 Ops mission; responsible for research, development, presentation and publishing All Source products at the tactical and operational level related to Iraqi IED activities, and long term threat as part of a local and/or regional stability as part of an overall intelligence team. Counter-IED All Source Analyst USD-N TF TROY J2 (Camp Victory - Baghdad, Iraq (MAY 2010 - MAR 2011) - Prepared All-Source Intelligence products to support TF Troy Counter-IED J2 Ops and combat commanders - Served as TF Troy’s subject matter expert on C-IED intelligence and operations for United States Division - North. - Served as a subject matter expert on the function and emplacement of Buried/Underbelly IEDs in the Iraqi Joint Operations Area (IJOA) - Produced and briefed tactical/strategic level IED related analytical products for theater wide dissemination in support of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation New Dawn - Managed database containing IED related event reports for USF-I Task Force Troy J2 - Produced and briefed convoy route IED activity reports for USF-I J4 convoy commanders, provided accurate visual picture of insurgent activity throughout Iraq Experience in MASINT and SIGINT processes and organizations: production and dissemination; reporting criteria, policies, regulations, and procedures for intelligence items; security classification, research gathering; organizing techniques; customer service principles; Intelligence community organization, mission, goals, and priorities (MAY 2003 – Present).
name: Pedro M. Ordonez

title: Data Analyst
company: Los Angeles Joint Drug Intelligence Group, FBI field office
description: Data Analyst assigned to a High Intensity Drug Trafficking Area (HIDTA) supported Federal Bureau of Investigations (FBI) intelligence site named the Los Angeles Joint Drug Interdiction Group (JDIG) field office (JUN 2006 – JUL 2007). - Extract raw data or additional information from databases and multiple investigative agencies - Data mine and extract raw intelligence from multiple sources and upload into various computer programs for analysis. - Establish/maintain databases and files - Analyze data and provide recommendations to case agents and law enforcement officers. - Assist analysts or official in acquiring/collecting all documents/information - Produce Visual Investigative Analysis charts, including but not limited to Analyst Notebook, Cross Case Analysis, Common Call, Call Distribution, and Organizational charts, graphs, and reports. - Research or cross reference the information on subjects, data and telephone numbers relevant to each case. - Assure information is accurate and perform analytical computations necessary to process data - Extract data from agency data for management and program reports - Provide pertinent information in assistance concerning case to multiple investigative agencies, local law enforcement agencies, US Attorney, and DOJ processing units and higher headquarters Assisted and provided research, management, analysis and dissemination information for ongoing investigative case files, conducted research from multiple databases, and analyze data, gathered relevant/pertinent data for the organization of created investigative files, packages, or cases for local, state and federal law enforcement agencies (JUN 2006 – JUL 2007).
name: Pedro M. Ordonez

title: Mercenary
description: Responsible for coordinating training for the Iraqi intelligence community. Coordinated training efforts with the FBI, DIA, NSA, USN, USAF and NGA allowing for the professionalization of the Iraqi Intelligence and Investigation Capabilities. Undertook an initiative to professionalize the Iraqi Intelligence force. Secured new intelligence course material, which will be institutionalized at the Intelligence and Military Security School (IMSS), known as the Iraqi Intelligence training Center of Excellence. Developed a timeline for translation, logistics, and travel that will enable the additional course curriculum to be accomplished at the IMSS. Coordinated with Division Branch Chiefs on project / tasking status and product inputs. SIGINT Analyst/ Counter IED Analyst National Security Agency (NSA)
name: Colm Coss

title: manager
description: Operated as an intelligence analyst and reporter while working with linguist and analysts in a joint environment to provide threat tippers, target characterizations, answers for Requests for Information (RFI's), and analytical products. Part of a team of Signal Intelligence Analysts in support of Brigade and Division level assets who developed high value individuals which led to the capture of numerous high value individuals and reduced the IED threat drastically. Exposure to All-Source Analysis systems, ELINT and FUSION Analysis as well as HUMINT andIMINT. Incorporated research and analysis of all-source data derived from multiple and specialized databases into actionable intelligence products. Wrote several Informal Technical Notes (ITNs) focused on high interest activity in the Middle East. Created working database for long-term analytical focuses and assisted in the construction of a new SOP in order to increase mission effectiveness and decrease the time needed for a new analyst to become mission capable. Experience with the following communications systems: GSM, HPCP, VOICESAIL, PUSH TO TALK, and DTMF Devices Provided training for intelligence soldiers ready to deploy on Insurgency communications, SIGINT analyst, target packages, and methodology behind tracking terrorist networks. Produced numerous SIGINT Intelligence packages for forward deployed units. (Daily use and access) software and programs: Association, Mainway, Banyan, Fascia, SIGINT Navigator, ArcView, GoldMiner, sharkFinn, GeoT,SortingLead, Renoir, Pathfinder, GRSOC Metrics, Analysts Notebook, Global reach, Gistqueue and Other SIGINT related databases Provided actionable intelligence reports in direct support of real world counter-terrorist operations. Worked in collaboration with various Intelligence Agencies in order to develop aterrorist database. COLLECTION ANALYST National Security Agency (NSA)
name: Colm Coss
